Does anybody understand why people buy books on eBay for prices way 
above what Amazon, for example, is charging? I see this all too 
often. Do people not check other online sources before bidding?

Amazon ($29.70 w/free shipping): http://tinyurl.com/8hkax

eBay (bidding starts at $41.99 + shipping): http://tinyurl.com/dqaeo

Or am I missing something here? I can understand when we're talking 
about out-of-print/hard-to-find volumes, but books currently 
available? And the book is a good reference, too. It's in my library 
already. It just seems to me that we already spend enough money on 
our hobby as it is, without wasting our hard earned cash needlessly.

And that was my gripe of the day. Thanks for listening.

Dewa,

Andres
